issue.title: nvidia_p2p_get_pages() failed
issue.body:
I just installed gdrcopy on my machine (Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-116-generic x86_64)) using CUDA 7.5, V7.5.17 (NVIDIA driver version 367.27), with an NVIDIA Tesla K20m GPU. After trying to run $ ./validate, the following error was printed in dmesg:
gdrdrv:nvidia_p2p_get_pages(va=704fe0000 len=327680 p2p_token=0 va_space=0) failed [ret = -22]

-22 = -EINVAL, and according to the [GPUDirect CUDA Toolkit page](http://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/gpudirect-rdma/index.html) that function returs -EINVAL if an invalid argument was supplied.
Does anyone have any bright ideas on why I can't do GPUDirect RDMA? Thanks.

comment.body:
for the records, sometimes during CUDA 11.6, the attribute below was added:
[CU_DEVICE_ATTRIBUTE_GPU_DIRECT_RDMA_SUPPORTED](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-driver-api/group__CUDA__TYPES.html#group__CUDA__TYPES_1gge12b8a782bebe21b1ac0091bf9f4e2a31d37205b1c55a2ef056e240fed6aca13): Device supports GPUDirect RDMA APIs, like nvidia_p2p_get_pages (see https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/gpudirect-rdma for more information)

pull_request.title: Remove check header dependency + include string
pull_request.body:
If I understand correctly check lib dependency was removed several month ago, but common.hpp file still contains header inclusion. When I removed this header, I got the following errors on Ubuntu 20.04:

![image](https://github.com/NVIDIA/gdrcopy/assets/22097249/e1a9d72f-b7e2-4673-be20-e6f16cc9d1b6)

So I decided to fix two problems by one patch.

issue.title: io_remap_pfn_range() failure caused gdr_map() to return EAGAIN
issue.body:
Hi, when using gdrcopy. Sometimes `gdr_map`  will failed with return code of -EAGAIN (-11).

In the dmesg, I can see error like

```
[1655746.266887] gdrdrv:gdrdrv_remap_gpu_mem:error in gdrdrv_io_remap_pfn_range()
[1655746.272760] gdrdrv:gdrdrv_mmap:error -11 in gdrdrv_remap_gpu_mem
```

Can you help understand what caused these errors and how can I fix them?

issue.title: io_remap_pfn_range() failure caused gdr_map() to return EAGAIN
issue.body:
Hi, when using gdrcopy. Sometimes `gdr_map`  will failed with return code of -EAGAIN (-11).

In the dmesg, I can see error like

```
[1655746.266887] gdrdrv:gdrdrv_remap_gpu_mem:error in gdrdrv_io_remap_pfn_range()
[1655746.272760] gdrdrv:gdrdrv_mmap:error -11 in gdrdrv_remap_gpu_mem
```

Can you help understand what caused these errors and how can I fix them?

comment.body: v2.4 should have a fix for this issue.

commits.message:
fix tests compilation without check

replace inclusion of check.h with cstring

fix build for OpenRM variant

nvidia-x.y/nvidia-peermem/ contains a copy of nv-p2p.h, so it may get picked as NVIDIA_SRC_DIR.
Later nv-frontend.c is searched there and cannot be found because it is located in a different subdir.
The fix is to search for nv-p2p.c, which is colocated along with nv-frontend.c.

Merge branch 'drossetti/gh180_fixes' into 'main'

two build fixes

See merge request gpudirect/gdrcopy!24

issue.title: error while loading shared libraries: libgdrapi.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
issue.body:
I have some problems while installing gdrcopy.
```
root@iZ8vbcavfdwt3inq0sbsj0Z:~/gdrcopy# make prefix=/usr/local CUDA=/usr/local/cuda-10.2 all install
GDRAPI_ARCH=X86
cd src/gdrdrv && \
make 
make[1]: Entering directory '/root/gdrcopy/src/gdrdrv'
Picking NVIDIA driver sources from NVIDIA_SRC_DIR=/usr/src/nvidia-450-450.80.02/nvidia. If that does not meet your expectation, you might have a stale driver still around and that might cause problems.
make[2]: Entering directory '/usr/src/linux-headers-4.4.0-198-generic'
  Building modules, stage 2.
  MODPOST 2 modules
make[2]: Leaving directory '/usr/src/linux-headers-4.4.0-198-generic'
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/gdrcopy/src/gdrdrv'
cd src && \
make LIB_MAJOR_VER=2 LIB_MINOR_VER=2
make[1]: Entering directory '/root/gdrcopy/src'
GDRAPI_ARCH=X86
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/gdrcopy/src'
cd tests && \
make CUDA=/usr/local/cuda-10.2
make[1]: Entering directory '/root/gdrcopy/tests'
make[1]: Nothing to be done for 'all'.
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/gdrcopy/tests'
installing in /usr/local/lib /usr/local/include...
removed '/usr/local/lib/libgdrapi.so.2.2'
'src/libgdrapi.so.2.2' -> '/usr/local/lib/libgdrapi.so.2.2'
removed '/usr/local/include/gdrapi.h'
'include/gdrapi.h' -> '/usr/local/include/gdrapi.h'
cd tests && make install DESTBIN=/usr/local/bin
make[1]: Entering directory '/root/gdrcopy/tests'
installing exes in /usr/local/bin...
removed '/usr/local/bin/copybw'
'copybw' -> '/usr/local/bin/copybw'
removed '/usr/local/bin/copylat'
'copylat' -> '/usr/local/bin/copylat'
removed '/usr/local/bin/sanity'
'sanity' -> '/usr/local/bin/sanity'
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/gdrcopy/tests'
root@iZ8vbcavfdwt3inq0sbsj0Z:~/gdrcopy# sudo ./insmod.sh 
INFO: driver major is 241 
INFO: creating /dev/gdrdrv inode
root@iZ8vbcavfdwt3inq0sbsj0Z:~/gdrcopy# cd tests/
root@iZ8vbcavfdwt3inq0sbsj0Z:~/gdrcopy/tests# ./sanity 
./sanity: error while loading shared libraries: libgdrapi.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

comment.body:
You can try to specify the location of your library by setting the environment variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH.
For example:
`export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib`

issue.title: Query: Confusion about sudo requirement
issue.body: I'm a bit confused about the need for `sudo` when installing `gdrcopy`--it seems to be required even for the from-source build. And yet the user-space HPC package manager `spack` has a `gdrcopy` package that installs just fine in user space, though I'm not convinced that it actually works via that route. Can you clarify on this--is it likely that the user-space install that `spack` does simply isn't viable or what is going on here?

issue.title: Query: Confusion about sudo requirement
issue.body: I'm a bit confused about the need for `sudo` when installing `gdrcopy`--it seems to be required even for the from-source build. And yet the user-space HPC package manager `spack` has a `gdrcopy` package that installs just fine in user space, though I'm not convinced that it actually works via that route. Can you clarify on this--is it likely that the user-space install that `spack` does simply isn't viable or what is going on here?

comment.body: GDRCopy hasn't been a problem for my config recently, so closing.

issue.title: Fail to access mapped memory from CPU side(Fail data_validation tests)
issue.body:
Hi there, I am running sanity test and I got this error in the data_validation test:
```
word  content expected
        13 a5a5a5a5 3f4c7e6a
        14 a5a5a5a5 3f4c1e6a
        15 a5a5a5a5 3f4cde6a
        16 a5a5a5a5 3f4d5e6a
        17 a5a5a5a5 3f4e5e6a
        18 a5a5a5a5 3f485e6a
        19 a5a5a5a5 3f445e6a
        20 a5a5a5a5 3f5c5e6a
        21 a5a5a5a5 3f6c5e6a
        22 a5a5a5a5 3f0c5e6a
```
I debug by myself and I found that in function: `init_hbuf_walking_bit`, the `buf_ptr` cannot be written. The content in it is always `0xffffffff`. And the corresponding gpu memory is never changed. (`a5a5a5a5`) in this case. There are no other errors during the whole process. All function calls return success. 

Here is the settings on my server(bare-metal machine):
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS
linux version: 4.15.0-213-generic
GPU: Tesla T4
Driver:
```
$ nvidia-smi
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 525.105.17   Driver Version: 525.105.17   CUDA Version: 12.0     |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                               |                      |               MIG M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  Tesla T4            Off  | 00000000:21:00.0 Off |                    0 |
| N/A   29C    P8    14W /  70W |      4MiB / 15360MiB |      0%      Default |
|                               |                      |                  N/A |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

```
```
$ ofed_info -s
MLNX_OFED_LINUX-5.4-3.4.0.0:
```


module:
```
$ lsmod|grep nv
nvidia_peermem         16384  0
nvidia_uvm           1216512  6
ib_core               311296  10 rdma_cm,ib_ipoib,nvidia_peermem,iw_cm,ib_iser,ib_umad,rdma_ucm,ib_uverbs,mlx5_ib,ib_cm
nvidia_drm             57344  0
nvidia_modeset       1241088  1 nvidia_drm
nvidia              56418304  49 nvidia_uvm,nvidia_peermem,gdrdrv,nvidia_modeset
drm_kms_helper        172032  2 mgag200,nvidia_drm
drm                   401408  6 drm_kms_helper,nvidia,mgag200,nvidia_drm,ttm
```
